prey.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: an animal, bird etc that is hunted and eaten by another animal
prey.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: the TARGET COMPANY (=the company that another company wants to buy) in a takeover
prey.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: MIN would prefer to be predator  (=a company that buys another company) rather than prey, but it was outbid in its last attempt to buy a regional newspaper.
prey.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: to be unable to avoid a harmful or difficult situation
prey.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: After opening higher, the OTC market fell prey to profit-taking.
The once-soaring South Korean economy has fallen prey to steep wage increases and high inflation.
